taskman.backend

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskman.backend.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is responsible for redirecting calls of the user interface to the responsible objects of the backend.
    Author:
    Alexander Braekevelt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Create a Controller for the given objects.

                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

        Parameters:

        password - the password of the user.
        Postcondition:
        a user is removed from the system.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the password is incorrect.

        Postcondition:

      • createProject

        public void createProject(java.lang.String name,
                          java.lang.String description,
                          java.time.LocalDateTime dueTime)
                   throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException,
                          java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a project with the properties.
        Parameters:
        name - the project name.
        description - the project description.
        dueTime - the due time of the project. (dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm)
        Postcondition:
        a project with the given properties will be added to the ProjectOrganizer.
        Throws:
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the dueTime cannot be parsed.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when one of the given parameters is not of a valid format.

      • createTask

        public void createTask(ProjectWrapper project,
                       java.lang.String taskName,
                       java.lang.String description,
                       long estimatedDuration,
                       double acceptableDeviation,
                       java.util.Map<ResourceTypeWrapper,java.lang.Integer> requirements)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       OperationNotPermittedException,
                       java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Adds a task with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        project - the project wrapper.
        taskName - the name of the task.
        description - the description of the task.
        estimatedDuration - the estimated duration of the task as Long.
        acceptableDeviation - the acceptable deviation of the task as Double.
        requirements - the requirements of the task.
        Postcondition:
        a new task is created and added to the project in the system.
        Throws:
        OperationNotPermittedException - if no user is logged in.
        OperationNotPermittedException - when the user is not allowed to create tasks
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if estimatedDuration is not a Long or acceptableDeviation is not a Double.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

      • addAlternativeToTask

        public void addAlternativeToTask(TaskWrapper task,
                                 TaskWrapper alternative)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Sets the alternative of the given task to the given alternative task
        Parameters:
        task - the task.
        alternative - the alternative task.
        Postcondition:
        the alternative task of the task is set to the given task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - the task must be failed to set the alternative task.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the alternative may not be the same task or its alternative or one of its dependencies or one of these alternatives recursively.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • addDependencyToTask

        public void addDependencyToTask(TaskWrapper task,
                                TaskWrapper dependency)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                                java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Adds the given dependency to the given task
        Parameters:
        task - the task.
        dependency - the dependency.
        Postcondition:
        the dependency is added to the task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the dependency is the task or its alternative or one of its dependencies or one of these alternatives recursively.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the task is already finished or failed.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • addRequirementToTask

        public void addRequirementToTask(TaskWrapper task,
                                 ResourceTypeWrapper resourceType,
                                 int amount)
        adds a requirement to a task
        Parameters:
        task - the task.
        resourceType - the type of the resource.
        amount - the amount of resources needed.

      • endTaskExecution

        public void endTaskExecution(TaskWrapper task,
                             java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                             java.time.LocalDateTime endTime,
                             java.lang.String status)
                      throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Ends the execution of the task.
        Parameters:
        task - the task to update.
        startTime - the start time of the task.
        endTime - the end time of the task.
        status - the new status of the task.
        Postcondition:
        the start time, end time and status of the task will be updated.
        Throws:
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the start or end time cannot be parsed.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the status does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the status is not FINISHED and not FAILED or if the start or end time is invalid.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • makeExecuting

        public void makeExecuting(TaskWrapper task)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Makes a task executing.
        Postcondition:
        the status of the task is changed to executing
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the user is not assigned to the task.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the plan cannot be rescheduled to this time.

      • exportSystem

        public void exportSystem(java.lang.String path)
                  throws ImportExportException
        Save the status of the system to a file.
        Parameters:
        path - a String with a location in the file system.
        Postcondition:
        the system is saved to the file.
        Throws:
        ImportExportException - if the system can't be saved to the file.

                  throws ImportExportException
        Restore the status of a system from a file.
        Parameters:
        path - a String with a location in the file system.
        Postcondition:
        the system is restored from the file.
        Throws:
        ImportExportException - if the system can't be restored from the file.
